reviews.review_msg: Ron is very interested in behavioural ecology and it shows. He knows his stuff and is very good at explaining concepts clearly. The one issue I had was that he mentioned his dislike of exams more than once but, despite being open book, the midterm and final were both tough and too long. I would recommend taking this course but do not slack!

Useless, him and the TA. First of all, no notes. Just random pictures for lectures. Second, his exams were over complicated that didn't match his teaching style in lectures. Third, he is very rude when approaching him with questions. His condescending attitude made it same like he didn't care about my education. Avoid him
Dr Lam is hands down the best prof in the biology department, his lectures are amazing and he will go above and beyond to help his students if they ask.

Amazing! 1st time he taught 410. His lectures are interactive which is great practice for your brain lol. Really teaches you about scientific research & TA also taught us about anti colonialism. Lectures are sometimes heavy & exams can be tough since you need to defend your answer well but practice and go to his many office hours!! He's the best :)

She's super friendly and approachable. Take the course only if there is lecture recording 'cause she mumbles a lot and you will miss out on stuff for sure. Test are fair, class assignments can be pointless sometimes. Uses iclicker. She gives really good feedback for papers and assignments. Does group exams which is weird and I'm not a fan of.

David is a delight. Lectures were interesting, funny, and informative. He consistently made himself available on Zoom, which was greatly appreciated for remote learning. He was responsive to feedback and more than fair with his expectations. I genuinely enjoyed this course both in terms of the content and the delivery.
